inn1.comm: starts with a length ball just outside off, Dilshan shoulders arms
shorter and same good line just outside off, terrific bounce there for Morkel, Dilshan stays well away from the line of that and allows it to the keeper
slants it down the leg side
pitched up and angling in towards middle stump, punched towards mid-on for a single
Morkel from round the wicket to the man of the moment Kusal Perera, who defends his first delivery
angles it towards leg stump this time, Perera looking to whip it towards square leg but misses
again on the pads, eased down to fine leg for a single this time
Tsotsobe starts with a length ball from over the wicket that swings away outside off, left alone
closer to off this time, a thick inside-edge sends the ball scurrying towards midwicket
back of a length ball, around off, pushed off the back foot towards cover

played uppishly but wide of the diving man at point, that was short of length and Kusal had to reach for it outside off, doesn't get forward or back but connect well and the ball trickles to the boundary
just outside off, good leave from Kusal
swinging in towards leg stump, solidly blocked to the left of the bowler
Morkel bangs it in back of a length, heading towards middle, worked to the leg side for a single
drives on the up once more, doesn't get it past the man at cover though
a muted appeal for caught-behind as Morkel sends down a bouncer, 134kph, Perera looks to hook but misses

a length ball this time, Perera latches on to that, launches it over cover for four, not timed too well but enough on it for the ball to reach the rope, and already Perera has his highest score in his past six ODI innings
slips it down the leg side, Perera shimmies across and looks it help it along to fine leg but he misses
length ball around off stump, steady defence towards cover off the front foot
and again, keeps it up and around off stump, blocked to the off side
shortish ball angling across, Dilshan looking to pull that away but badly mistimes it and the ball rolls towards square leg, the bat turns in his hand as  he plays that shot
length ball on off stump, blocked towards the bowler
left alone outside off
angling across the batsman who chases after it and misses
nicks it this time, a slower ball 117kph, outside off and that bounces through to first slip
length ball slanting across, allows it through to the keeper, and that's a maiden from Tsotsobe
pitches it up, keeps it around off, 134kph, defended towards cover, slight misfield from Miller who allows the ball to slip past him

Morkel gets the first wicket, shortish ball outside off, Perera goes for the pull, bottom-edges it through to the keeper, big appeal and the umpire doesn't need much convincing, another single-digit score for Kusal, big disappointment for a whole bunch of our readers
short ball down the leg side, South Africa's bowler remain profligate
better line and length from Morkel, just back of a length and not too far outside off, defended to the off side
well outside off, Thirimanne looks to slice that through the off side, the ball skids between the bat and body, and seams in a long way after passing the stumps making it a tough take for de Kock
pitched up and on off stump, Thirimanne gets behind his line and blocks it
pitched up and a crisp drive towards cover, where the fielder dives to his right to cut it off
Dilshan fishing for the ball outside off stump, it cuts away from him and he is beaten
a touch shorter this time, Dilshan attempts a flamboyant slash through the off side but misses
length ball on off stump, 131kph, defended from the crease towards cover
back of a length this time, keeps it on off stump, 129kph, blocked to the off side
same length, on middle and off, Dilshan looks to flick it through the leg side but ends up tapping it back towards the bowler
back of a length is blocked back to the bowler, back-to-back maidens for Tsotsobe to Dilshan
probing line around off, watchful defence from the crease
just a touch wider this time, more defence, this time towards point
another wide from Morkel, much too far outside off, Morkel isn't too pleased with the call though
back of a length and just outside off, guided down to fine leg and that is the first run off the bat since over 2.4
shortish and outside off, slaps that firmly through cover but Duminy manages to haul that in before it reaches the rope
Dilshan connects sweetly as he pulls that away for a boundary, it was shortish and on off stump, not too much wrong with it, but Dilshan has had enough of watchful batting
suddenly the runs are flowing, this time Dilshan threads it through the off side, places a pitched-up delivery between cover and extra cover to pick up another boundary
that's 15 dot balls in a row for Tsotsobe, this one is on off stump and it is defended towards midwicket
Thirimanne gets inside the line of that one and guides it down towards third man, Thirimanne races back for the second, Morkel a touch slow there in the deep
defended to the off side this time
length ball outside off, defended off the front foot towards point
length ball outside off, an outside edge down towards third man for a single
short of length and on off stump, thrashed towards cover but can't beat the fielder
lovely shot from Thirimanne to welcome McLaren, a full ball is punched back down the ground for a straight-driven four
replies with a yorker on off stump, Thirimanne manages to get his bat down in time
opens the face to guide the ball towards backward point, can't place it well enough though
fullish and on middle and leg, defended towards mid-on
short of a length and angling towards off stump, McLaren bowling from a bit wide of the crease, more defence from Thirimanne
length ball on off stump, blocked back to the bowler, good recovery from McLaren after that opening ball four

dropped or did it drop just short of Amla at wide slip, dropped short of Amla actually, amla could have stopped that though, Dilshan looked to drive that one through the off and gets a thick edge towards slip
Tsotsobe bowling an immaculate line here, absolutely no room for Dilshan, who looks to manufacture some by backing away from the stumps, can only defend that towards point
a bit of width outside off, defended off the front foot towards point
Tsotsobe pitches it up but that was well wide of off stump, worked away towards deep backward point
grunts as he bowls the final ball of his fifth over, on a length and outside off, left alone
McLaren starts the 11th with a length ball outside off, defended towards point
short ball outside off, Thirimanne bends his knees as he allows the ball through to the keeper
length ball on off stump, Thirimanne happy to keep blocking these to the off side
pitched up on off stump, punched towards mid-off, Thirimanne taking a leg-stump guard and then moving across the stumps before the ball is bowled
shortish from McLaren, Thirimanne decides to go after that, he loves the cut and he plays it uppishly, Behardien cuts it off at deep point
full and just outside off, pushed back towards the bowler
a hint of away swing there, a length ball is driven off the front foot towards mid-off
Dilshan backs away from the stumps and plays a risky stroke past the keeper, there wasn't any width to work with there but he spots that the third man is vacant and dilshan guides it there for four
that was a half-tracker that Dilshan should have put away, Dilshan wanted to power that towards square leg, can't connect properly and sends it down towards fine leg

dropped? or did it fall short of Amla again, a length ball that is flicked towards short fine leg, this time it carried but it was a difficult chance, low and wide ot his right, Amla puts in a solid effort but can't collect it
more work from Amla as he has to field at short third man this time
a controlled glide down towards third man to end the over
on the pads, flicked away for a single to bring up Sri Lanka's 50
no footwork at all from Dilshan as he pokes at that one outside off, he's beaten
short of length ball is helped along down to fine leg for a single
pitched up and angling in towards off stump, bowled from round the wicket as he has all along to the left-handers, pushed towards mid-off
length ball just outside off, defended to the off side

close call there, Thirimanne pokes the ball towards point and sets off, a direct hit at the keeper's end and that could have been trouble, a superb diving stop form Faf to cause some confusion in the runn9ing
sensible worked towards square leg for a single
eased down to third man for one more
full and wide, slapped towards sweeper cover for a single
length ball around off, eased towards long-off, no trouble working Behardien around
full ball on the pads, whipped towards midwicket, can't place it well though
wide outside off, slashed towards backward point
short of length and outside off, Thirimanne can't time it as he looks to punch that through point off the front foot
tries to pulls that shortish ball off the front foot, bit of a top edge but luckily for Thirimanne that lands safely between two fielders, deep backward square leg fields
slants in towards middle stump, solidly defended towards the bowler
pitched up and on off stump, Dilshan remains patient, pushing it back towards the bowler
full ball outside off, Dilshan looks to power it through the covers, mistimes it to the man there
balls seems to slip out of Mclaren's hand as he delivers a full toss outside off, Dilshan looks to thrash that through cover but poor placement there
gives him width and he cuts it hard but point slides and stops it
pushes it to sweeper cover for a single
comes round the wicket to Dilshan, he softly pushes it to the off side
fullish in length on the stumps and driven to cover
tucked to midwicket where Amla dives and stops, Thirimanne steps out and has to hurry back
stays beside the line and he punches it to sweeper cover
well outside off, slapped towards deep point
Dilshan plants his front foot forward and looks to drive through the off but that doesn't spin in, goes straight on and Dilshan is beaten
opens the face as he plays that towards deep point from the crease
defends this towards the off side
a length ball on off stump, defended down the track
whips it towards deep midwicket
Phangiso is a bit short first up, Dilshan is quickly on the back foot, gets his front leg out of the way and slams it towards deep midwicket
towards deep point for a single
length ball on off stump, clipped towards deep midwicket
an appeal for lbw as Dilshan looks to sweep, but that struck him outside leg
almost drags it on to the stumps, a bottom edge as he looks to work the ball to the off side, bounces over the stumps
solidly defended to the off side
defended watchfully by Thirimanne
pokes it towards point this time
full and on leg stump, a big sweep from Thirimanne, gets on one knee as he plays that, perfect timing and that sails over the midwicket rope, well done by Thirimanne
on the pads, Dilshan gets on the back foot and works it towards deep midwicket
flighted and full, Duminy skips down the track and punches the ball towards a straight midwicket
length ball on offstump, driven just wide off teh diving bowler, a single to mid-off
pushed towards point for a single
flighted and full, driven down towards long-on for a single
gets well back in the crease and defends
thumps this into the ground before it lobs towards the bowler
a tighter over this from Phangiso, this was dropped shorter as Thirimanne skips down the track, pushed back to the bowler
full ball just outside off, worked towards midwicket for one more
slides this down the pads, looking to help it down to fine leg, no bat involved but the ball runs down to fine leg nonetheless
on a length outside off, defended towards the off side
watchfully played to the off side once more, flighting the ball here
skips out of the crease and eases it towards mid-off
full ball and Dilshan dances down and thumps that between the bowler and mid-off
outside off and he looks to run it down to third man, misses
driven towards long-on for a single
flighted length ball on middle and off, Dilshan gets on one knee as he swings that towards deep midwicket
a bit of  an outside edge as he looks to push that full ball outside off, that sends the ball fine past short third man, Amla has a a long chase but he manages to win the race with the ball
gets well forward and defends
looks to sweep that one and he misses, a big lbw appeal is turned down, that flighted down was going down leg
driven down to long-on for one more, easy single
steps out and launches that length ball towards sweeper cover, he was looking to go towards long-on there
length ball is defended by Thirimanne
short ball spins away outside off, chopped towards deep point for a single
full ball on the pads, clipped towards square leg, Dilshan wanted one but Thirimanne immediately (and wisely) turned down the single
short ball sliding outside off, guided towards backward point
flighted length ball on off stump, Phangiso misfields Dilshan's drive to concede the single to long-on, in fairness that was a tough stop for Phangiso who had to dive to his right
full ball and Thirimanne launches that over mid-off for four, every now and then Thirimanne goes for the big shot and he has pulled them off perfectly so far
full ball on the pads, clipped towards midwicket
around off stump this time, plays the paddle sweep to get a single
flighted length ball on middle and off, solidly defended towards the bowler
a leading edge towards mid-on as he looked to work the ball towards midwicket, it was a short of length ball heading towards leg stump
fuller this time, punched towards mid-off by Thirimanne
shortish ball on leg stump, pulled towards square leg
short of length ball outside, Dilshan crisply drives between cover and extra cover and that brings up his half-century
full and on middle and leg, clipped towards deep midwicket
nearly played on there, Thirimanne opens the face and looks to run a ball from just outside off towards third man, bottom edges it to the leg side
Dilshan exposing his stumps as he drives towards extra cover

once again Thirimanne charges out and looks to loft over mid-off, the bat turns in his hands as he play that shot, he ends up slicing it to the right of Amla at mid-off, instead of over Amla as he had intended
gets on the front foot and drives that behind point, a couple of runs to Thirimanne
a full ball on the pads, squeezes it out towards point
length ball on middle stump, driven to long-off for a single, typical mid-innings ODI batting
full and just outside off, Thirimanne completes his fifty with a poke towards point
pitched up by Morkel, 131kph, pushed towards mid-on
not the most convincing of strokes, an edge sends the ball behind square leg
helps it along to fine leg for one more
short of length and just outside off, Thirimanne looks to power the ball through point but he's beaten
what a shot, terrific from Thirimanne, a half-volley from Morkel, Thirimanne gets a good stride in and plays a beautiful drive that sends the ball between cover and mid-off
Morkel has his hands on his head after Thirimanne bottom-edges a ball, almost back towards the stumps
length ball on off stump, defended towards the off side
short of a length, 132.5 kph, opens the face to guide the ball down towards third man
a length ball angling in, Thirimanne drives it back towards the bowler who doesn't get a hand on it before the ball crashes into the non-striker's end with Dilshan well out of his crease
slips in the slower one, that fools Thirimanne, hits high on the bat and the ball loops towards mid-off but lands short
back of a length and outside off, guided down to third man for a isngle
not too short from McLaren but that doesn't stop Dilshan from going for the pull, connects well and that sends the ball to the midwicket boundary
length ball spinning in from outside off, defends to the leg side
length ball is whipped towards deep midwicket, Thirimanne was looking for a big shot out there, doesn't connect properly
towards the middle stump, pushed back to the bowler
tossed up and on middle and off, pushed towards long-off
an appeal for lbw but Thirimanne is struck outside the line as he looks to sweep
full ball is clipped to square leg
short of length ball on off stump, Dilshan opens the face and guides the ball towards point
short of length ball around off, pushed to the off side from the crease
angling in towards the pads, tucked towards square leg for a single
another lofted drive from Thirimanne, once again he isn't looking to power the ball, happy to chip it over the man in the circle, connects well and Thirimanne looking at ease here
width outside off, slapped towards deep point
angling in towards the stumps, defended to the leg side
superbly done by Dilshan, who waits on the back foot and chops that behind point for four, not much width for him to work with but enough for Dilshan, especially when he is in this form
looking for the big drive, he misses the flighted and full ball
tosses it up once more, sliding down the leg side, Dilshan can't get bat on it but it is off the pads for four leg-byes
length ball on middle stump, blocked off the front foot
full ball on middle and leg, eased towards long-off and they amble a single
misses a stumping chance, Phangiso fires it down the leg side, Thirimanne is way out of his crease and misses the glance, de Kock misses the ball and Thirimanne survives, that's a wide as well
flighted delivery on off, Thirimanne gets forward and defends it
and his first ball is taken for a boundary, past deep backward point, Behardien from round the wicket, it was a short of a length ball, short enough for Dilshan to put it away
punches that towards deep extra cover for two more
driven towards extra cover, a dot ball
tucks this towards backward square leg
Dilshan is switching gears, he's decided Behardien has to go, a length ball from round the wicket, Dilshan gets on one knee and swipes that to the square-leg boundary
scoops it fine this time, down to fine leg for more runs, Sri Lanka speeding up here, and South Africa could be in for an ugly hour or so ahead
length ball from over the wicket, what a beautiful shot from Dilshan, the straight drive, effortlessly struck, rolls past for four, he's now 84 off 87
full ball on off stump, driven towards cover this time
length ball on the pads, defended to the leg side by Dilshan
short ball on off stump, pulled towards deep square leg by Dilshan
short ball outside off, pulled hard towards deep midwicket
length ball is driven towards long-off for one more
length ball on middle stump is punched back towards the bowler
driven off the front foot towards extra cover for a single
fires it down the leg side
skips across the stumps and sweeps that behind square leg, Tsotsobe gives up the chase very early as he realises there's no chance

superb catch from JP Duminy, SA were looking for a bit of magic to get the wicket, Duminy provides it, a terrific-looking lofted driven from Thirimanne, again not full power on it, Duminy has to move towards the boundary to get under that, he keeps his eyes on the ball and connects that well, tumbles over after taking that catch, but he makes sure the ball remains in his palm, end of a solid innings from Thirimanne
stretches forward and drives towards cover
on middle stump, Dilshan defends, the ball pops up a little off the bat, but no danger at all of carrying to bowler,
length ball is driven towards long-off for a single
full ball on legstump, punches the ball towards long-on
full ball outside off, squeezed towards sweeper cover
length ball around off stump, gets forward and defends towards point
full ball is whipped towards midwicket, doesn't beat the fielder
Sangakkara is in red-hot form this year, he shows that by stepping out and launching that over the bowler's head for a boundary
short of length ball on off stump, dabbed towards point for a single
short of length ball on the pads, wrong line, and that is punished, oh so elegantly done by Sangakkara, just a gentle clip after getting inside the line

length ball on middle and leg, pushed towards mid-on, Sangakkara is sprinting for a single, Dilshan is going nowhere, Sanga has to turn back and races towards the crease, puts in the dive as well, just in time to beat the direct hit
full and well outside off, Sangakkara lets it through to the keeper, just close enough to the stumps to not be a wide
and once more it is wide outside off and angling away, just within the limit once more, another dot ball to end the over
slants that down the leg side
length ball is driven off the front foot towards extra cover
slower ball, 116kph, goes badly wrong, it was short and Dilshan had ages to put that away, he decides it send it to the midwicket boundary, four more, and he's onto 94
another short ball angling in, pulled away just behind square leg
length ball on off stump, Sangakkara shuffles across and defends to the leg side
slower ball is pushed towards mid-on for a single
full ball angling in, worked towards mid-on
short of length ball outside off, no feet from Dilshan as he throws his bat at it, doesn't connect
length ball is driven crisply to mid-on, a quick single is taken
lovely stroke from Sangakkara, a length ball is lofted over mid-on, as ever gracefully struck by Sangakkara, doesn't look to power that one, just enough to clear the man in the circle
full and outside off, Sangakkara crashes that to the sweeper cover boundary, South Africa in tatters here, another classy shot from Sanga
short of length ball on off stump, defended towards point

short of length once more, on leg stump once more, helped along to the deep backward square leg boundary, Tsotsobe at backward square jumps as he tries to catch that but that is just over is fingertips, Sri Lanka piling it on here
full ball outside off, driven towards cover, and things getting worse for South Africa as they concede not just the quick single but an overthrow as well, Dilshan on 99
length ball angling in, cut in late, Dilshan keeps bat and pad close as he defends off the front foot
a yorker from McLaren, Dilshan squeezes it out, bounces towards the non-striker's stumps
the wait continues for Dilshan, just outside off, and he chops that towards point
a low full toss, just outside off, defended towards extra cover

bowled 'im, no century for Dilshan, it was a slower ball that tailed in towards the stumps, it was full and heading for middle, Dilshan looking to drive to the on-side, he doesn't cover for the movement and that crashes into middle, a rare moment of joy for South Africa
length ball outside off, another effortless drive from Sanga, a slight misfield from AB, and the single is taken
length ball on middle and leg, clipped towards midwicket for a single
length ball on off stump, Sangakkara moves across the stumps and pushes it past the bowler
shortish ball on leg stump, helps it around to deep square leg for a single
shortish and that is thumped over midwicket, enough power on it to beat the man in the ring, and another boundary for Sangakkara
full toss on the pads, lucky to escape with that one, Sangakkara thumps it to deep square leg
short on middle, tucked to square leg for a single
round the wicket to Mathews and full on the pads, Mathews fails to connect
length ball outside off, Mathews steers it close to short third man for a single
full on middle, Sangakkara drives it to long-on
length ball on middle, Mathews can't get it past midwicket
length on off, Mathews sweeps it over square leg for a couple
full and angling towards leg side, driven to cover for a single but overthrows from AB gives them two
short of length outside off, Sangakkara cuts it in style between point and short third man for another boundary, excellent timing
length ball on the pads, clipped on the leg side for a single
length ball outside off, guided to point
slower ball on the stumps and Sangakkara wanted a single there but he's sent back and would have been run out had the fielder struck at the non-striker's end
length ball outside off and another dot, Mathews can't get it past cover
full on the pads, tucked to short fine leg for a comfortable single
fullish on Mathews' pads, tuck to the leg side for a single
full on off, Sangakkara chips it to long-on
Mathews has broken his shackles here, dances down the pitch and loft a full delivery straight for a six
full on the stumps, driven back to the bowler
short of length on middle and leg, Mathews tucks it through midwicket for a couple of runs
attempted yorker on leg stump, the ball takes a thick inside edge and runs to fine leg for a single
full and outside off, Mathews makes room and smashes this one straight past the bowler for a four. It came from the meat of the bat
short outside off, Mathews cuts it late to short third man for a single which brings up SL's 250
length ball on middle, Sangakarra sent it straight to Miller at midwicket who tried for a direct hit and the overthrow gave them a run
slower ball on off, pushed to point
short on off, Mathews pulls with power but can't get it past midwicket
round the wicket and full on middle, Sangakkara guides to square leg for a single off the back foot
tossed up on the pads, driven to long-on by Mathews
short ball, Sangakkara pulls to fine leg for a single
short and flat, Mathews pushed it back to the bowler
quicker one outside off, Mathews drives it through the covers for a single
flighted delivery way outside off, Sangakkara makes room and cuts it straight to point. Just four singles off that over
short on middle, Mathews pulls and AB misfields at midwicket which gives them two runs
straight to Miller at long-off. It was a full delivery outside off and Mathews makes room to swing his arms but he hands a simple catch to David Miller at the boundary
short and slow outside off, just within the limit to not be called a wide
short outside off again and Perera is off the mark in style. He waits for it and scoops it over the infield to the third man area for a four, it landed just inside the boundary rope
length ball on the stump, pushed to point with soft hands for a single
it's short of length outside off and Sangakkara gets close to the balls and plays it horizontally to deep square leg for a single. But it's overthrows again and they get two
full ball is whacked towards extra cover
another yorker from McLaren, Perera manages to swing it away towards long-on, well bowled by McLaren
goes for the yorker again, he misses this time, it doesn't land, on the pads and Sangakkara sends that away towards fine leg for four, brings up his half-century
skips away from the stumps, chops the ball towards point
Sangakkara standing at least a yard outside leg stump when the bowler runs in, drives this full ball in front of point
keeps it full, Perera manages to get under that and scoop it towards long-off, bounces a couple of times before reaching the man there
Perera knows one way of batting - smash everything - it was shortish from Morkel and on the body, he slugs that towards deep square leg
pitched up and well outside off, Sangakkara reaches out and whirls that towards deep point

Sangakkara goes for the extravagant. he misses out on an attempted scoop over short fine leg, he makes a hash of it but still edges it down to third man for four more, he has 355 runs in this  series now, the most by a Sri Lanka batsman in a bilateral series
full and wide, Sangakkara was backing away from legstump, reaches across and sends it to sweeper cover
bottom hand comes off the bat as Perera powers a full ball to long-off
this time Sangakkara pulls it off, he's been dancing around in the crease, he skips across to the off side and whips this over short fine leg for four more, he's in awesome touch here
good yorker from McLaren, on legstump, making sure Perera gets no room to swing his arms, punched towards long-on for a single

Sangakkara is attempting all sorts of innovative strokes here, a sort of reverse-scoop here, wanted to send that over the keeper, miscues it to the off side, that was a full ball outside leg and it was edged onto his body there
sends that full ball to backward square leg, back to Sanga's pyrotechnics
instead of moving to the off side or beyond leg stump, he dances down the track this time, down to long-off
keeps it full, good over from McLaren this, Perera can't get under that one but sends it towards point

ho ho ho, Sangakkara having an absolute blast here, this time he gets it over the keeper's head for four, he moved across the stumps, and flicked that full toss that was heading for the stumps back over the keeper
short and wide down the leg side
full and outside off, powered to mid-on
stands his ground this time, strikes that towards deep midwicket for two more
slogged from well outside off towards deep backward square leg
a low full toss, and yet again a one-handed hit from Perera, hit low on the bat but still has enough to clear mid-on and get a boundary
slower short ball, Perera wanted to send that into orbit beyond midwicket, misses and that is off his body for a single

what a hit to end the innings, Sangakkara has absolutely relished his chance to bat under little pressure, charges down and hammers that short of length ball towards wide long-on for four, the people who came here have been treated to a superbly entertaining innings

inn2.comm: length ball shaping in towards off stump, defended off the front foot towards cover
short of length just outside off, dabbed towards cover
cracking stroke to get going, full and outside off, de Kock slams that through point for four
plays with an angled bat as he looks to push that short of length ball towards cover, bottom-edges it
length ball outside off, superb timing on drive by de Kock through the covers, Chandimal gives chase and puts in the dive to haul that in just before it reached the rope
beauty of a delivery first up, comes in with the angle and then swerves away after bouncing, difficult delivery to face first up, Amla is beaten by that outside off
short of length ball just outside off, defended towards the bowler
swings and misses outside off, flashing at that one, again playing with the angled bat
length ball outside off, driven off the front foot towards deep point
length ball on off stump, Amla gets behind the line and defends
blocked towards mid-on this time
short of length ball angling in, eased towards midwicket
Amla looks terrific when he plays the drive, on the up as he sends that towards cover, no placement on it however and a diving stop means SA get no runs
on middle and off, stays in the crease and defends towards midwicket
slanting down the leg side, Amla misses out as he looks to whip that to the off side, off the thigh pad
short of length around off stump, defended down the ground
length ball, Amla looks to drive that through cover, thick inside-edge onto his boot
beautiful from Amla, what a shot that is, drives it on the up, sends it through the gap between cover and extra cover for four
this full length ball, outside off gets slapped straight to point
Full and wide of off again but this one gets the inside half of the bat and goes to the bowler
Struck through the covers. he gets a good stride forward to this full ball outside off and he slams the ball through the off side
Oh, he's hitting the ball hard. Short and a bit of room and he flays this to the left of point. Third man tidies up well
Lovely shot. Another short and wide ball and he stays back on his crease and cuts it to the right of point. Third man is far to fine to cut this one off
punched to mid-on and they scamper for a quick single
Length ball angling into off stump and its a short-armed punch which flies off the middle all the way to the extra cover boundary
Good thinking. Slower ball from the bowler and de Kock loses his timing. Mishits it back to the bowler
Fullish ball, outside off and he comes forward and punches it to the off side
Around the off stump again and its hit to cover
He's camping on his back foot. Fullish ball on off stump and he carves it out to point
There he goes again. Just a little bit of room and he cuts it powerfully through point. The off side in-fielders can't do anything about it
Off spinner, full on the pads and is hit to mid-on
Moves back and hits this off spinner behind sqaure leg
A little flight this time and Amla flicks it to midwicket

He's gone. His stumps are broken the first ball he faces against the spinner. This one turns into the left hander, but de Kock playing for the ball turning away from him cant bring his defensive bat in line with the ball and he's clean bowled
Flighted off spinner and its hit to short extra cover
Good hands from Duminy. He waited for that one, got well back in his crease and cut the ball between the two fielders square on the off side. Well timed
Full ball on the stumps, defended solidly to mid-on
A little slower this one and its turned to midwicket
A little too straight and this length ball gets picked off the pads to deep square leg off the back foot
Bouncer. He's pulling out all his variations, is Mathews. But Duminy sees this early and ducks under it safely
Short ball again and he gets hold of it this time. Goes back and pulls it strongly to deep square leg
He moves across his stumps and flicks this slower, length ball, which was well outside off, down to deep fine leg where Chandimal makes a good diving stop
he comes down the track and drives to midwicket
Full and on the stumps, Amla moves back, covers his stumps and turns it into the on side
Off spinner and Duminy goes back and defends to point
This one turns the other way. Duminy picks it off the pitch and turns it down to fine leg
They're playing him off the back foot. This one is punched back straight
he makes room and hits it down to mid-off
length ball on the stumps and he punches it back down the ground
shortish, with a little room outside off and he chops it off to point
Full ball, not quite half-volley but Amla moves confidently forward, presents the full face of the bat and watches it go all the way to the long off boundary. Lovely straight drive
Opens the face of the bat to guide this length ball outside off to third man
This was a half-volley, outside off and Duminy gets onto his front foot and pulls out an eye-catching coverdrive. Goes all along the ground.
Oh, JP! Straight drive this time. Fullish ball on off stump and he just strokes this down the ground. Good timing once again
Goes back and picks this one off his hips to square leg
This one goes the other way and Amla opens the face to point
Angling toward the off side and its pushed to cover
Full, flighted ball gets the inside edge and goes on to the pads as Amla tries to drive through the covers

Another one for Sennanayake. And its the big one. Amla misreads the one that goes the other way and is trapped in front of the stumps. He moves back to turn the ball to leg, tries to correct his shot and plays straight but still misses it and is struck on the pads.
Flighted on the stumps and he defends it back to the bowler
Flighted on the stumps, hit back to the bowler
on the stumps and defended back straight
Goes on the front foot and drives into the off side
Goes down the leg side and Duminy goes on one knee and tries to help it on its way, but misses

Goes back again and is caught plumb in front. Dlishan is absolutely elated, skipping about and waving his arms with a big smile on his face. It is a length ball to which he goes back and Duminy tries to defend it but misses completely
full and on middle stump and gets the leading edge to mid-off
Full ball and its hit down to mid-on
De Villiers moves forward and dabs it down to mid-on
Full ball met with solid defense
Moves across his stumps and drills it off to midwicket
Angled down leg, turns further and he dabs it off to fine leg
Full ball, defended with the straight bat
and he pulls out the lap sweep. on the pads and he tucks it around the corner to fine leg
Full on the off stump and its defended solidly
Faf comes down the track to this full ball and hits it off to mid-on
Full on middle and he flicks it between midwicket and square leg
comes down the track and defends it solidly
Perera starts with a full ball that is dug out towards the off side

Perera's uncanny ability to take wickets is on show again, just his second ball, it is outside off, du Plessis looks to carve it through the off side, he can only nick it through to the keeper, another poor day for Faf, no footwork at all from Faf, very loose as he played outside off
short of length just outside off, defended down the track
short of length ball, around off stump, blocked to the off side
seams in after pitching back of a length outside off, blocked from the crease
length ball on off stump, a wicket maiden for Thisara, defended to the leg side
a full ball is driven back towards the bowler
length ball on middle and leg stump, worked behind square leg
length ball around leg stump, defended to the off side
full ball outside off, whacked towards the leg side
full and just outside off, looks to drive towards cover and inside-edges it to the leg side
more defence from Behardien, asking rate now 6.80
back of length ball outside off, carved towards sweeper cover
back of a length ball seaming away, pushed towards cover
short of length ball outside off, punched towards cover
short and well outside off, chases after it and misses

another loose stroke outside off, almost like Faf, chasing outside off, this time there's no edge through to the keeper, that doesn't stop Sangakkara from belting out an appeal, Perera is late to join in
pitched up and that is punched back to the bowler, Behardien still looking for his first run
short of length ball around off stump, not much spin, defended
AB skips out of the crease and launches that over mid-off for a boundary, lovely shot that
defended solidly down the track
fired in towards the pads, blocked to the leg side
on the pads, whipped behind square leg
the legspinner, AB reads it though it pitches outside off, guides that towards deep backward point for four more
short of length ball outside off, left alone by Behardien
same length, on middle and leg, defended to the leg side
length ball, looks to drive through the off, inside-edges it towards mid-on
length ball sliding towards the pads, defends to the leg side
full and well outside off, slapped towards cover by AB
short of length ball is blocked to the off side
shortish ball outside off, slapped towards deep point for a single
Behardien waits on the backfoot and defends to mid-on
the offspinner, a cagey Behardien blocks to the off side
looking to work that to the leg side, he misses but that slips down leg

Behardien absolutely clueless against that one, a flighted offspinner, Behardien waits on the back foot to play it but he's beaten outside off as the bat comes down much too soon, not too far from off either,
spins the other way and Behardien defends to the off side
somehow Behardien survives the over, not a great ball from Mendis to finish, slants it onto the pads, off the pads towards square leg
Lakmal starts with a shortish ball well outside off, de Villiers decides to try pull that, but mistimes it towards midwicket
angling in towards middle, inside-edged to square leg for a single

the end of Behardien, will it be the end of his international career for a while? utterly uncomfortable in the middle, looking to slog that to the leg side, hit high on the bat and it loops to give mid-off a simple catch, 1 off 22 balls is truly awful
Miller slices his first ball towards point

oh dear, there goes Miller as well, what a shambolic performance this is turning out to be, a nick through to the keeper, once again the batsman doesn't move his feet and chases the ball, easy for Sangakkara, AB watches helplessly from the other end
short of length ball way outside off stump
rears up from back of a length, McLaren allows it through
an inside-edge towards midwicket
comfortably driven towards mid-off
length ball spinning towards off, McLaren confidently gets forward and defends
slides on straight, thick outside edge sends the ball towards point
flatter and on the stumps, blocked towards the bowler
the offspinner, AB gets forward and drives that towards long-off
length ball on off stump, defended towards the leg side
goes for the yorker, on middle stump, worked away to the leg side for a single
short of length and angling across, 131kph, left alone outside off
back of a length ball on off stump, 134.4kph, defended to the off side
full ball is thumped back at the bowler's feet, Lakmal gets down to get his hands on it, off his arms towards mid-off
length ball is driven towards mid-on
fired down the leg side, defended towards square leg
full and down the leg side, tucked towards square leg
length ball on the pads, clipped towards midwicket
length ball on teh pads, whipped towards deep midwicket
slaps that towards deep point for a single
nearly a catch there, a full ball on the pads is whipped just wide of midwicket
length ball on off stump, defended to mid-off
on the off stump, defended down the track
back of a length ball on off stump, guides it towards point
punched towards the off side towards cover
helped along down towards third man for a single
back of a length, just outside off, gracefully driven by de Villiers towards sweeper cover
spinning in towards middle from round the wicket, solid defence down the track

pitched up ball that AB chips towards long-on, shouts of 'Catch' as that sails towards long-on, lands just short, the fielder was unsure whether to go for the catch or hang back for it, makes a hash of it
skips down the track and drives firmly towards the bowler, who fires the ball towards the keeper

poor ball down the leg side, AB goes for the sweep, replays show that he hit it, Sangakkara was absolutely convinced it was out, until the umpire ruled it not out, when it was time to decide whether to go for the review, he wasn't so sure, AB definitely hit it though
skips down the track and lashes that down the ground for four
quicker delivery on the pads, clipped to midwicket

another huge appeal, this time for lbw but it was clearly sliding down the leg side, another discussion, this time they do go for the review, poor call that, should never go for a lbw referral unless you are dead sure it is out, marginal calls go down as umpire's call, and this time you could see middle and off when the ball struck the pads, DRS shows it would have missed leg stump, review is gone
works this length ball from just outside off in front of deep square leg for a single
on the pads, whipped down to fine leg by McLaren
cracks that towards sweeper cover for one more
overpitched and that is a awesome shot from AB de Villiers, skips out to reach the pitch and pounds that over the bowler's head for six, heading straight for the sightscreen
short of length ball outside off, dabs it towards point for one more
back of a length ball around off stump, defended behind point
full ball is superbly swept to the square-leg boundary, AB is terrific touch
length ball on middle, eased towards long-on
flighted, length ball wide outside off, pushed towards extra cover
slides on after pitching on middle, tucked towards square leg
length ball on off stump, shows the full face as he defends
full and down the leg side, helped towards backward square leg
spins away from a length around off, defended to the off side
length ball around off, watchfully defended to the off side
slides on after pitching around middle and leg, another loud lbw appeal, that was going down leg side, it was the carrom ball
spinning across after pitching on a length outside off, defended towards point
strides forward as he guides the ball towards mid-on
short of length ball on middle and off, defended to the off side
length ball from round the wicket is pushed back towards the bowler
skips away from leg stump, pushes the ball towards extra cover for a single
full ball just outside off, thwacked towards sweeper cover
down the leg side, helped along towards deep square leg
length ball around off stump, blocked off the front foot
looks for the reverse-sweep, struck on the pad but just outside off I think
length ball on off, doesn't turn in, pushed towards mid-off

the SA innings may be a shambles but AB is playing something of a gem here, not that it is going to change the match but still, great shots to watch, this one is square drive that sends the ball racing to the boundary
there's the fifty for AB after tucking the ball off his pads, sends it behind square leg
McLaren skips down the track and lofts that towards the vacant long-on boundary, another boundary
flighted length ball outside off, driven towards extra cover for one more
beaten outside off as he looks to drive through cover
spinning away outside off, looks to chop that towards point but misses
three time he misses, this one doesn't turn away but goes straight on, McLaren searching for the spin and doesn't connect
gets bat on it finally, pushed towards scover
gets well forward and works the ball towards midwicket where Mendis fields
driven towards deep square leg for a single, McLaren keeps strikes
forward defensive from McLaren
goes back and cracks that towards sweeper cover
on the pads, whipped behind square leg for a single
flighted length ball well outside off stump, left alone
flighted ball on a length, McLaren goes for a sweep, he misses and the ball just misses off stump
Full ball, comes forward and defends it

And he gets a wicket off his first ball. He makes a little room for himself and heaves the ball into the off side off the front foot, but he neither gets the elevation, nor had he placed it well. Goes straight to point who takes a simple catch
Full ball, attacking the stumps and Morkel comes forward to defend it
Lovely flight. The ball spins away this time. Morkel goes for the big swing, misses completely and Sanga whips off the bails. We're off to the third umpire's box. He looks safe to me. And he is.
straighter ball. A little shorter, outside off. He tries to chop it but misses
He's gone. Mendis proves too good for the No. 9. Googly from Mendis defeats Morkel's defensive prod and hits the stumps. Its drinks
Nice, accurate ball and it gets the outside edge of his tentative defense
comes forward and defends solidly
shorter ball and he goes back and punches it off to deep square leg
Length ball, coming in, defended to the off side
Turn there. Length ball outside off, comes in sharply to hit him on his thigh
Full ball, turning in, he goes back to it and only manages a leading edge to point
Flighted, on off stump. He goes back again and is hit on the pads. There's a loud appeal, but it has hit him outside the line
goes back and hits this length ball turning away back to the bowler
googly from Mendis again, beats his slog sweep and Sanga collects it around his neck
Full ball, turning away. He goes for a reverse sweep, doesn't work. Not the first time either thats happened either.
goes back to the good old forward defensive
Length ball on the stumps, comes forward and defends again
Clipped off his pads to deep midwicket to get off the mark
Full ball, he stays on the crease and defends it
dabbed into the leg side off the back foot
angling to off stump, he comes forward and defends
shorter, turning in and he goes back to push it to leg side
accurate bowling from Senanayake, he goes back and dabs this length ball on leg to the short-leg fielder
full, flighted ball, hit to mid-off
Solid forward defense again
This turns in sharply. Phangiso is on the back foot and he has to jump out to the leg side to make room to cut it to point. Close call
He goes for it. Flighted ball and he comes the track and hoists it straight over the top. Two fielders after it, but it lands beyond them both
googly again, raps him on the pads as he comes forward to defend, but there's an inside edge
Goes back and pushes it to leg gully
Down the track again and turns it to the on side
Ball is angled in and McLaren manages to get his inside edge in line with the ball
Full ball angling to off, Another reverse sweep, to no avail
Outside off and turning away, stroked away to point
Comes forward and smothers the turn inward with as he defends it
Full on the off stump and he squirts it off square on the off side
Full and more on the pads and he puts his front leg aside and pushes to mid-on
on the stumps and defended
chips down the track to the googly and it hits him on the pads as he defends it
Good strike. Stays inside his crease this time and slams it straight over the bowler's head. Couple of bounces and strikes the boundary
Quicker ball. Much quicker. Its 115 kph. Phangiso's up to it as his forward defensive comes into play again
shortish, outside off. He goes back and cuts it square on the off side
short ball, cut strongly to point
pitches on middle and turns even more away, tries to help it on its way but misses
on the stumps, a little shortish and he goes back, makes some room and plays a lovely square cut. Good strike
Full and on middle, Phangiso is stuck at the crease this time and defends it
Goes back and flicks it down to square leg
Full and turning away outside off and its driven firmly to long off
full, flighted and turning in. defends it safely
comes down the track, turns it into a full toss and hits it down the ground to long-on
he looks good. Comes confidently forward and drives it through extra cover. Poor fielding by the man in the deep lets it go to the boundary
Makes room and drives well through the covers again
both these batsmen are driving well. this one is on leg stump, but he makes room and punches it through the covers and the long-off can't cut this off
Goes back and cuts this straight to point
tries the sweep, but it turns too much. beats the bat
goes back again and punches it to the right of point this time for a single
pitching in middle and leg and spinning in towards McLaren, defended off the back foot
again safely negotiated off the back foot
skips down the track and clips it towards deep square leg

Mendis strikes again, McLaren's vigil is over, Mendis came round the wicket this time, a slower one with plenty of flight, a top edge from McLaren as he looks to chop that, on to the keeper's pads and loops up for first slip, Mendis has three
massive turn there for Mendis, did it hit some sort of crack? it stays very low and turns way down the leg side
length ball on off stump, solid forward defensive from Tsotsobe
a flighted googly turns towards middle, a thick inside edge sends the ball towards square leg
slides that in towards middle and leg, pitched up, defended off the front foot to the off side
shortish ball angling in, Tsotsobe ducks under, umpire signals that's the first bouncer of the over
short of length and on off stump, 133kph, blocked to the off side
Lakmal angles this down the leg side, looking to glance that towards fine leg, off the pads to the boundary
it's all over, Lakmal aims for the top of off and gets it through the defences of Tsotsobe, who seems surprised that is sneaked through
